intro: Oxera baladica subsp. nuda, commonly known as the slender oxera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, showy flowers. The plant typically features slender stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are borne on pedicels and bloom in the spring. Oxera baladica subsp. nuda is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
